title: 245473 - Junior Unreal Engine Developer - DigiBC Work Placement

details.value:
Restrictions to Eligibility (DigiBC):
This position is part of DigiBC's Work Placement Pilot Program, which supports post-secondary students by providing experiential learning opportunities in animation, video, games, visual effects, and XR. As a part of this program, participating students will benefit from customized orientation workshops, e-learning resources, mentoring support, and the opportunity to start building their own professional network in the creative technology industry. This position is open to students who are Canadian Citizens, Permanent Residents, or Protected Person as defined by the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act.

NEED HELP TO RELOCATE?
If you're traveling outside Victoria for a co-op work term, you may be eligible for a limited $1,000 travel stipend through the Strategic Framework Experiential Learning Fund (SF-ELF). For details, see the section Co-operative Education Travel Awards for Work Terms outside Victoria

Company Overview:

At A Shell In The Pit, we're on a mission to create good jobs working on great experiences. While we are known for our audio work on 60+ titles including Pacific Drive, Untitled Goose Game, Five Nights at Freddy's and many more, we are also seeking assistance for our flagship title, Fish Game, the most comprehensive home aquarium simulator ever made.

Position Overview:

We are looking for a proactive and eager-to-learn Junior Unreal Engine Developer Co-Op to support our team in experimental systems development in our game Fish Game. This is an exciting opportunity for students who want to gain hands-on experience within the Unreal Engine 4 on a well-reviewed game that is already on the market.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the current team to revise existing systems, ideally converting blueprints to native C++ systems for improved optimization
Assist in the creation and execution of test plans and test cases for the game
Perform manual testing to identify and report bugs and issues to ensure a smooth gameplay experience including bug tracking
Write clean, efficient and well-documented code
Participate in reviews, feedback sessions, and contribute ideas to improve testing processes and workflows

Qualifications:

Currently enrolled in a Computer Science, Software Engineering, Game Development or a related program
Comfortable writing C++
Experience/knowledge of developing in Unreal Engine 4
Experience in QA and/or the ability to thoroughly check one's own work
Proficient in using GitHub for version control and collaboration
Ability to think critically and work through issues with both users and software functionality
Comfortable collaborating with other developers, designers, and stakeholders in a team-oriented environment
Ability to document work clearly and communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical team members

Nice to Have:

Enthusiasm for biology, especially fish
Experience keeping aquariums

How to Apply:

Please submit your resume and a portfolio consisting of examples of your work and/or codebases relevant to the role. If you have any GitHub links, or personal projects that demonstrate your skills, feel free to include them! Applications without portfolios will not be considered.
